intro: Manihot hahnii, commonly known as the arrowleaf mallow, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive arrow-shaped leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Its stems are often hairy, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. Manihot hahnii is typically found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands.
